sections.heading: Selling Your Las Vegas Home for Relocation
sections.content:
Relocating for work is exciting, but selling your Las Vegas home quickly enough to coordinate with your move can be incredibly stressful. Whether you're transferring for a corporate job, receiving military PCS orders, or taking a new opportunity across the country, you need to sell fast—and you don't have time for a lengthy traditional sale process.

At Alchemy Investments RE, we specialize in helping Las Vegas homeowners sell quickly for job transfers and relocations. We understand that your timeline is critical. You may have already accepted a position with a start date, signed a lease in your new city, or received orders that require you to report within weeks. Waiting months for a traditional sale isn't an option.

We can make you a fair cash offer within 24 hours and close in as little as 7 days—or on whatever timeline works best for your move. No repairs needed, no showings to coordinate while you're packing, no uncertainty about whether a buyer's financing will fall through. Just a simple, fast transaction that lets you focus on your relocation instead of worrying about your house.

sections.heading: Common Relocation Scenarios We Handle
sections.html:
Corporate Job Transfers

Your company is transferring you to a new city, and you have 30-60 days to relocate. You're already house hunting in your new location and coordinating with the moving company. The last thing you need is the uncertainty of a traditional home sale that could take months and fall through at the last minute.

We work with corporate relocators regularly. Whether your employer offers a relocation package or you're handling the sale yourself, we can close quickly and give you one less thing to worry about during your transition.

Military PCS Orders

When you receive Permanent Change of Station (PCS) orders, your timeline is non-negotiable. You need to report to your next duty station by a specific date, and selling your Las Vegas home needs to happen quickly. Military families often face unique challenges—you may already be overseas or stationed elsewhere, making it impossible to manage showings, repairs, or a traditional sale process.

We have tremendous respect for military families and understand the urgency of PCS moves. We can handle the entire transaction remotely if needed, coordinate with your power of attorney, and close in time for your orders. We've worked with service members from Nellis AFB, Creech AFB, and other bases throughout the region.

Starting a New Job in Another State

You accepted an exciting new position across the country with a start date just weeks away. You've already found housing in your new city, but your Las Vegas house is still on your hands. You can't afford two mortgages, and you don't have time to wait for a traditional buyer.

A cash sale solves this problem completely. You can close before your start date, use the proceeds to help with your relocation expenses, and begin your new job without the financial burden of maintaining two properties.

Temporary Housing Situations

Some relocating sellers have already moved and are paying for temporary housing or a hotel while their Las Vegas home sits empty. Others are trying to coordinate showings from hundreds or thousands of miles away. Both situations are expensive and stressful.

We can take over your vacant property and close quickly, ending your double-housing expenses. If you're already in your new location, we handle everything remotely—you don't need to fly back to Las Vegas for inspections or closing.

sections.heading: Why Traditional Sales Don't Work for Relocations
sections.html:
Most relocation sellers initially consider listing with a real estate agent, but this approach creates significant challenges:

  • Timeline uncertainty – Traditional sales average 60-90 days from listing to closing. Add in time for repairs, staging, and listing preparation, and you're looking at 3-4 months minimum. Most relocations happen faster than that.
  • Showing coordination – If you're still living in the home while working full-time and packing for your move, coordinating last-minute showings is a nightmare. If you've already moved, managing showings from another state is nearly impossible.
  • Repair requirements – Buyers and their lenders often require repairs after inspection. When do you have time to coordinate contractors while planning a cross-country move?
  • Financing contingencies – Most traditional buyers need financing, which can fall through at the last minute. If a deal collapses two weeks before your start date, you're in serious trouble.
  • Double housing costs – While your Las Vegas house sits on the market for months, you're paying the mortgage, insurance, utilities, and HOA fees—all while also paying rent in your new location.
  • Stress and distraction – Relocating is already one of life's most stressful events. Adding the uncertainty of a traditional home sale makes it exponentially worse.

Cash buyers eliminate all of these problems. You get one clear offer, one closing date, and the certainty you need to plan your relocation with confidence.

sections.heading: Relocation Assistance and Your Home Sale
sections.html:
Many employers offer relocation assistance packages, but these packages vary widely in what they cover and how they handle home sales:

Direct Reimbursement Packages

If your employer is reimbursing you for relocation expenses but leaving the home sale up to you, a cash sale can be the fastest way to liquidate your asset and access those funds for your move. The money from a quick sale can cover moving costs, temporary housing, and help you get established in your new city.

Corporate Relocation Companies

Some employers contract with relocation management companies like Cartus, SIRVA, or Graebel. These companies may purchase your home or coordinate the sale. However, their offers are often based on multiple broker price opinions (BPOs) and can take weeks to process. If you're not satisfied with their offer or their timeline doesn't work for you, selling to us directly may be a better option.

Lump-Sum Packages

If you received a lump-sum relocation payment and are responsible for managing your own move, selling quickly for cash maximizes your financial flexibility. You can use your relocation bonus for moving expenses while accessing your home equity immediately.

No Relocation Assistance

If you're relocating without employer assistance, a fast cash sale is even more critical. You need to free up capital quickly to fund your move and avoid carrying two housing payments. We can help you close fast and access your equity when you need it most.

faqs.question: How quickly can you close if I have a tight relocation deadline?
faqs.answer: We can close in as little as 7 days if needed. For most relocations, we recommend 10-14 days to allow for title work and coordination with your moving schedule, but we're extremely flexible. If you have PCS orders or a firm start date, tell us your deadline and we'll do everything possible to meet it. We've closed in as few as 5 days for urgent military relocations.

faqs.question: Can I sell my house after I've already moved to another state?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. We handle remote closings regularly for sellers who have already relocated. We can evaluate the property, make an offer, and complete the entire transaction without you returning to Las Vegas. Remote notarization and power of attorney arrangements make this simple. You can close on your Las Vegas home from anywhere in the country.

faqs.question: What if I'm still living in the house and coordinating my move?
faqs.answer: That's completely fine. We don't require showings, open houses, or keeping your home in "show-ready" condition. We'll schedule one visit that works with your schedule, make our offer, and let you focus on packing and planning your move. You can stay in the house until closing day.

faqs.question: Will I have to make repairs before selling?
faqs.answer: No. We buy houses as-is, which is perfect for relocating sellers. You don't have time to coordinate contractors, wait for repairs, or invest more money into a house you're leaving. We handle all repairs after closing, so you can leave the property in its current condition.

faqs.question: How do you determine your offer for a relocation sale?
faqs.answer: We evaluate your property based on its location, size, condition, and recent comparable sales in your neighborhood. We understand you need a fair offer quickly, so we provide transparent pricing that accounts for the speed and convenience we offer. Our goal is to make you an offer that works for your situation and timeline.

faqs.question: Can you coordinate the closing with my moving company and new lease?
faqs.answer: Yes. We work with your schedule entirely. If you need to close before the movers arrive, we can do that. If you need to close after you've already moved but before your first rent payment in your new city, we can accommodate that too. We're extremely flexible with closing dates to match your specific relocation timeline.

faqs.question: What if my employer's relocation company made me an offer, but it seems low?
faqs.answer: This happens frequently. Corporate relocation companies often make conservative offers based on multiple BPOs. You're not obligated to accept their offer. Get our offer and compare—you may find that selling to us directly nets you more money and closes faster. We're happy to work with you even if you're in the middle of a corporate relocation process.

faqs.question: I'm in the military and received PCS orders. Can you work with my power of attorney?
faqs.answer: Yes. We work with military families regularly and understand POA arrangements. If you've already deployed or relocated to your next duty station, your attorney-in-fact can represent you throughout the transaction. We'll coordinate with them, your legal team, and the title company to ensure everything is handled properly.

faqs.question: What documents do I need to sell while relocating?
faqs.answer: You'll need your property deed, mortgage information, photo ID, and any HOA documentation if applicable. If you're selling remotely, we can work with digital copies of most documents. The title company will provide the closing documents, which can be signed remotely through secure online notarization if you've already moved.

faqs.question: Will I have to pay any fees or commissions?
faqs.answer: No! Unlike selling with a real estate agent (which typically costs 6% in commissions), there are no fees, commissions, or closing costs when you sell to us. The cash offer we make is the amount you'll receive at closing. This transparency makes it easy to plan your relocation budget.
